column4: I was wanting to encrypt my harddisk, 200gb, using truecrypt in feisty. however, i noticed that when you mount a file volume to a folder or something right now, to get stuff onto it you have to do it as root. if i encrypt the entire disk, and then mount the entire disk, will i have to always use sudo to write to it?
maybe you can use "-o uid=$USER" as mount option to get acces for you as user
um, what? so i would do, for example, sudo truecrypt /path/to/file -o uid:$matt
